page.title: 05RIVER WENSUM,DRAYTON AREA
page.content: The river{Wensum,}one of East Anglia's major rivers,follows a particularly attractive course through the valley between the old{mills}at {Taverham}and{Hellesdon. } {Taverham Mill}provided half of the paper for Times newspapers in its heyday,but is now disused.Downstream from the mill,the river flows through lush pastures and meadows,under the railway bridge at{Drayton}& onto the mill in{Costessey,}where it forms a magnificent weir pool.From Costessey the river proceeds to{Hellesdon, } narrowing in places to half its width elsewhere. There are some beautiful{walks}by the river,and it also provides some good{fishing}being a prime{chub}river, with the chance of some large{barbel, {roach},{pike}and the occasional{brown {trout}from the natural stock upstream.
